Reviews.Title: “Good for business and thats it”
Reviews.Author: kentgrad
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for 2 weeks for business and found this property to be a good fit for me. I will stay again when I go back to Boston. If I was going for pleasure to see an event at The Garden, this again would be an excellent property. It is literally across the street from The Garden. The subway is within 1 block and Quincy Market is 2 stops away. This property is close to the downtown happenings so the location is excellent. Its a bit hard to find as the entrance is on a side street, but once you realize where you are going its fine. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast wasn't that good, I would say a bit below HIE standards but the lady running the breakfast was good at keeping the coffee hot and fresh. The room was clean but a bit on the smaller side. Again, this is East Coast traveling so you have to expect smaller rooms and less overall quality compared to the rest of the U.S. They had a nice business center- a bit small and the computers were a bit older- but it served its purpose. The only issue you may have with the business center is that it is in the basement and there is no staff monitoring the room. If I were, for example, a female traveler alone I might not feel so safe hanging out down in the room. The workout room was TINY but at least they had one. The workout room is across the hall from the business center and both have a glass wall. That means that anybody walking by can watch you working out and/or anybody in the business center can watch you working out. Not exactly the most ideal situation. They offered a $10 off-site workout option but I didn't take them up on the offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near to subway to explore city”
Reviews.Author: Glyn_Derby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during short city break. The hotel is a good location near the North Station which has access to the subway and Commuter Rail lines. The rooms are a good size and are a good standard. Overall service of the staff was very good and were helpful. The only down side was that the room was on the Friend Street side which was noisy at times in the early hours with people coming out of bars and waiting for taxis near the TD Garden. If you want a quiet room ask for one at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wudwork
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there 1 nite. Bathroom was clean, excellent shower pressure, plenty of hot water. King bed was very comfortable. Furniture was dated, but since we don't use it; so what. Nice equipment in fitness center, included breakfast was amazing! They included eggs (hard boiled or scrambled), toast, bagels, bacon, sausage, cereals, pancakes, juices, coffee, muffins, cinamon rolls and more. This alone is top notch. Our room was over front door (5th floor) and we did NOT hear any noises on street or from any other rooms. Staff was excellent and entertaining. No problems leaving our bags behind counter while we walked around on depart day. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: airmom330
Reviews.Content: Since the decline of our economy we are looking for the most competitive hotels who identify and apply what the guest is lookin for in their hotel stay-whether for business or leisure. HI Express Boston Garden exemplifies the connection between strategy and competition. They understand the needs of the guest and provide courteous services efficiently in catering to the guests needs. The employees at the front desk impression of excellence and thorough quest to provide each customer a home away from home is exemplary. The staff provides a personalized touch to each guest with a commitment of service that is lacking in the hotel industry. Customers usually look for hotels that have broad amenities, quality at a reasonable cost. The staff and management of Holiday Inn Express Boston Garden have exceeded in understanding and capitalizing on the factors that make the hospitality industry a success. A website may advertise but the best success in advertisement is the experience a guest has at this hotel. That is why so many return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: davekat04
Reviews.Content: It was easy to find getting off the train, right across the street. The location was great for what we needed that weekend. TD Garden & close to the T. The staff was very helpful & pleasant & the rooms were great. We would defiantly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Value and Downtown Convenience”
Reviews.Author: PerfectJourneys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a less expensive option for those wanting to be downtown with easy access to pretty much everything. The hotel is located directly across the street from North Station (north shore commuter rail & Amtrak from Maine & New Hampshire) and The Boston Garden (a sporting and event venue) which can be a plus or a minus depending on your needs! It is a very short walk to Faneuil Hall & Quincy Market, the North End, the Aquarium, the waterfront, and the subway or the north bound trains to take you anywhere else you think you might want to visit. While the easy access location has it's plusses, it also has minuses! Being directly across the street from the Garden means that it can be quiet busy and noisy if there are events going on. Depending up on the event and the time of day, sleep can DEFINITELY be interrupted. Add to that, is the fact that there are several bars located with in a door or two of the hotel. I suggest making sure to pack earplugs if you are a light sleeper or are bothered by boisterous noise. The lobby is open and bright and the front desk staff courteous and proficient. Even though the hotel has recently been "refubished" and opened as a Holiday Inn Express, it already has a rather "tired" feel to the elevators, hallways and rooms. BUT, at often less than 1/2 the price of other downtown hotels, a little nick and/or wear on the furniture is something that I can deal with. The rooms are clean and during my 5 or 6 separate stays, I have not had anything to complain about. Guests need to be aware ahead of time of the potential location noise and the fact that this is NOT a 4 or 5 star property. For clean rooms, efficient and responsive staff, a central location and good rates for a Boston hotel, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Want2GoHome
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of reviews for this hotel. Here are my two cents: - staff is great - friendly and helpful - I think the small size of the hotel helps - great location (for the price) - especially if you are attending events in the Garden (or the restaurants/bars near by). If not, you can actually walk to quite a few attractions and it is 2 blocks from the T station - renovation is nice. Building is OK and layout is odd. It actually felt like one of those old lower tier hotels in some large cities - rooms are of different sizes. I was upgraded to a larger room - huge room (even compared to other suburban locations) but tiny bathroom - definitely good value whether paying cash or using points - noise (from the bar patrons on the streets outside) is an issue but not too bad for me as I was on the top floor

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: 695Robin_L_11695
Reviews.Content: My sister and I will be staying here summer 2012 & booked our stay already. I HAD to write a review even before my stay because the customer service that this hotel offers is OUT OF THIS WORLD! The manager was exceptional & responds to emails and feedback instantly. She is going way above and beyond to make our stay here at Holiday Inn Express and memorable one! I highly recommend this hotel on the customer service alone!! I am looking forward to an amazing stay & will write another review this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, but NOISY and unclean”
Reviews.Author: M R
Reviews.Content: On the surface this hotel seemed great. Very stylish decor. Free breakfast. Great location near the T. But looks were a bit deceptive. The noise of the street is pretty unbearable. I live in a lively and loud area of New York City and can sleep through lots of street noise, but the noise outside this hotel was unbearable. All three nights were loud, either drunk yelling people, street drummers drumming on plastic tubs for change as people left the Bruins game, or the club across the street blaring music. Noise was steady from about 10:00pm until 2:00am. Hotel staff said sorry, they couldn't change my room. The rest of the amenities are good. Room seemed clean until my last night when I realized that the bedspread had an old blood stain on it and I had been sleeping under that blanket for three nights. I wanted to like this place but after three nights of this I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious loft style rooms near North Station”
Reviews.Author: BlogGrandVoyageur
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the value and central location near North Station for our first visit to Boston. We stayed 3 weeknights and didn't have the noise problems from the other reviews, so maybe it's worse on the weekends. We were on the 4th floor facing TD Garden and did hear some traffic noise/ sirens etc. They were doing road construction with jack hammers, but didn't notice until we walked outside. Check in was fast and they were great about holding a package at the front desk before our arrival. The room had high ceilings, a bath, and a kitchenette, but no sofa bed or walk in closet like some other rooms. The kitchenette didn't have much in the way of dishes or cutlery except for some disposable dishes. The overall design of the room and bathroom was ok, but nothing extraordinary. There was also some sort of lingering onion like odor, so we opened the windows to air out the room. The elevator could use a lick of paint and was missing a mirror. Felt more like a service elevator actually and was a bit slow. The complimentary breakfast had scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and sausages along with toast, bagels, fruit, cereal and a pancake machine. Not much daily variety though and three days was enough. We also received free wi-fi as Priority Club elite members which worked fine when the log-in screen would show up. Had to manually type in the url on my iPad sometimes. The location was ok for us first time visitors and we walked pretty much everywhere and took the T if we were too tired to get back. Overall we had a comfortable stay for a good price, but would chose a different location for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price, here are some tips...”
Reviews.Author: Lepnor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently refurbished and the staff seems to be making true efforts to make the hotel as good as possible with what's given. For the price that we paid (175 USD / night), and comparing to Boston downtown - it was decent and a good place stay. -- Helpful tip: ask for the highest room available, since the windows don't block the noise from the street (at all..), and the location is very crowded with Boston Garden and North station just out of the window. The corner rooms are the biggest. Cons from our stay: 1. Noise from the street 2. Although refurbished, some things are still old or require maintenance (we've had a problem with the toilet and the air conditioning wasn't too useful). Pros: 1. Location is very good: 2 minutes walk to T's north station, walking distance to downtown locations 2. Staff - are trying to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The staff responded to our requests quickly and in an efficient way. 3. The refurbished rooms have LCD tv and some new furniture Bottom line - was okay if you take into consideration all the above and know what to expect. We will stay there again for the same price as most of the things were okay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy outside; cozy inside”
Reviews.Author: LeShock22
Reviews.Content: Our room, on the top floor with views of TD Garden, was recently refurbished, stylishly decorated and spacious. We had a walk-in closet, sofa-bed, flat screen TV, and a kitchenette with mini-fridge, microwave, sink and cupboards. It looks quite swank and thankfully was functional too. So many of the newly refurbed HIEs we've stayed in are all style and no substance; our room at this hotel really did serve us well. The hotel is conveniently located close to North Station and is just across the street from TD Garden, so there are plenty of buses, taxis and shuttles nearby. There are plenty of places that are walkable from the hotel: North End, Feneuil Hall, Quincy Market and a gigantic Whole Foods are all easy to get to on foot. In fact, Boston is a very walkable city in general and we walked everywhere from our hotel, including the Aquarium, Boston Common, Chinatown, Downtown, the Theatre District, Bunker Hill and the USS Constitution. We had bought seven-day travel passes for the subway and water taxis, but found we rarely needed to use them. Back to our room. One problem we had with the room was if we used the wall switch to turn on or off our lights, the alarm clock would also switch off because the socket it was plugged into fed off that main wall switch. That's bad design. Another issue we had when we first arrived was that our toilet was running constantly and wouldn't flush correctly. We rang the front desk and someone from maintenance came to repair the problem almost immediately. We had no further problems with it after that. There were a few downsides to staying at this hotel. Our room, with it's four large windows, got chilly and the thermostat wasn't very useful. A nice feature of the windows is that they can be opened a little bit to let in the fresh sea air, but keeping them open at night is impossible due to the number of bars blasting out pulsating, thumping music. And even if the music wasn't an issue, the number of drunken, yelling people staggering around in front of the hotel is definitely a problem. There is a pizza joint across the road that only seems to be open in the evenings to feed loud-mouth drunken women who have no idea how to keep their gobs shut. Even with the windows bolted shut, don't plan on sleeping until after the bars close and the taxis carry the wrecked, gobby women away. Or bring earplugs and hope for the best. Another issue we had with this hotel was the breakfast area. It is incredibly compact, and we noticed that guests with disabilities were pretty much left out because their wheelchairs or walkers couldn't fit the snug space. And then there was the morning that they ran out of several breakfast items and didn't bother to tell anyone until several guests raised their voices about it. Only then did one of the hotel staff wander over to the computer terminal and print out a sign stating they were out of eggs, bacon and pancake mix. For a hotel to run out of so many items at once seems like whomever handled inventory wasn't doing his or her job. Since they were out of so many items that morning I opted for cereal, which had to be discarded because it was beyond stale. Luckily Boston is full of Dunkin' Donuts. Hotel concierge weren't very helpful either. We overheard a group of elderly guests ask about a certain tour they wanted to go on, and the concierge kept trying to steer them toward another tour instead. Finally one of the group said, "This is the tour we would like to book. Can you help or not?" And the concierge said he could not. Later, we heard the concierge telling his co-worker that the group wanted a tour that he didn't get a kick-back from, so he wasn't going to help them out. Then they hi-fived. On our last morning in the hotel (we stayed seven days) the hot water in our room packed it in and we couldn't shower before our flight. We rang the front desk about it but no one answered. When we went downstairs to see someone in person, all the phones were ringing and two other groups were waiting to check out, and no one was around. One of the red-jacketed concierge was in the room, but he had his back to the front desk, surfing the internet. All in all, the hotel gets good marks for the room itself, which was comfortable and spacious, but it gets poor marks for just about everything else except its proximity to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: austinlightwriter
Reviews.Content: As a platinum level member, I have stayed at literally hundreds of Holiday Inn Expresses. This hotel was definitely not your typical 'Express' property. The feel of the hotel is very industrial with stone floors in the lobby and beams and pipes exposed in the ceiling. Upon first entering the hotel, I was very tempted to look for another hotel elsewhere. The rooms were small but clean and serviceable. However, we had a third floor room facing Friends Street, and the late night crowds at the local pubs were boisterous until way into the early morning hours, hence we didn't get much sleep. The nightly rate combined with the $39/per night parking fee definitely added up to sticker shock. Aside from a downtown location near the Boston Garden, I didn't find a whole lot to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Leaking from ceiling and large wet black mold stains”
Reviews.Author: sfo-ord-bos
Reviews.Content: Checked in to room 217 and it was terrible: the ceiling was leaking and at a couple of places black stains of mold (each as large as a dining plate and, yes, all wet) were staring at me above the bed (photos uploaded). Contacted the front desk a couple of times and the response was to wait for the maintenance person to come up in an hour. Asked an agent at Egencia.com for help and when she called the front desk, she was told that "because it rained yesterday"! How does the rain leak to the second floor of the six floor building, and how does the mold grow so quickly in a day? I was feeling sick from the mold and requested changing to Park Plaza Hotel. If I will be sick for an extended period of time, I would request a compensation from this hotel. How come the hotel does not notice this leak - it must have been there for days - and does not recognize the health risk of the mold? I would sincerely hope that Holiday Inn does not endorse such a neglect of the health safety of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't do this again.”
Reviews.Author: TKDTX
Reviews.Content: This is certainly not a conventional Holiday Inn. It's kind of interesting, and the room was fine, but didn't like the location at all. Very old building, very odd layout, very little service available. The only possible good comment about the location is that it's close to the Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: RNG123
Reviews.Content: Very cold rooms but otherwise great stay! Great breakfast and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Clean”
Reviews.Author: travelnomi
Reviews.Content: If you are going to any TD Garden events, be sure to stay at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Boston Garden. It is right across the street! There are lots of bars so if you are looking for a night scene, you'll find it nearby. After a night out you can look forward to a big comfy bed and good cable tv (sports channels and Bravo). The room is spacious, clean and modern. There is a continental breakfast in the morning which I didn't have but liked the option. There is valet service for $39. Not bad and very necessary for there is little parking in the vicinity. All in all, a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of sorts.”
Reviews.Author: HotelRockmiser
Reviews.Content: First off, the location here is absolutely amazing. If you're a wicked Boston Bruins fan than you'll enjoy the Aceticket next door for the game and the TD Garden RIGHT ACROSS THE FRIGGIN STREET! If not and you're just there to hang out, this place is certainly for you. There's so many award winning dining experiences around and its near the Freedom Trail line. Pretty much, everything you need or want to see is there. Including the T station across the street at the TD Garden which will take you everywhere else. There's a breakfast every morning that looks delicious (but I only have Dunkin Donuts while I'm in Boston, sorry). But everyone knows about the breakfasts at the Holiday Inn Expresses by now: Bacon, big sausage patties, cereal, coffee, all of that jazz, so let's get on to the room. The room, well, it's a standard one because that's all they had by the time i could get this booked two weeks before I left. (Through priority club so I only paid 40 dollars a night for five nights). The room is a pretty decent size, I wouldn't say huge or anything like that, but you got a fold out couch that is pretty old and leans in when you sit on it. The AC/HEAT is great, keeps both rooms well enough temperature controlled, but the bedroom should really have its own for the winter months. The bed is nothing special, and was kind of hard to sleep in comfortably for another person (if it's just you... GREAT!) The rooms walls are kind of thin, which kinda sucks when the room next door come back at two in the morning and lets the door slam shut (woke me up, both nights). The staff is great and very kind, catering to all my needs (which I have little of) and the valet was very helpful in pointing out where things were when we looked a little confused on the sidewalk. All in all, I enjoy my stay here (still got two nights left to go) and YES, I will stay here again when I'm on Boston. You really can't beat the convenience, and if you book early enough, you can get a classy room (saw one when walking by a room that was being cleaned) and enjoy it more fully, but if you're planning on just staying in the hotel the whole time you're there, then well.... I guess it still works for that with all the food around. So, good for everybody for everything. There you have it.

Reviews.Title: “Good: Rooms, Location, Staff, FREE Internet”
Reviews.Author: ringinthenewyear
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed being located in an area that I can walk to restaurants, shops, and sight seeing spots. The staff work hard. I asked for another blanket and that was brought up. I would be happy to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Place to crash”
Reviews.Author: datherrien
Reviews.Content: It's a convinent place to crash (right across from the Boston Garden) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. But that's about it. If current decor, cleanliness and working AC is important then it's not for you. I've stayed in probably 100 different Holiday Inns/Crown Plazas etc. and this was one of the worst. However, I'll stay again because it's just so close to North Station, The Garden and North End.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: robrende
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Boston for our first time. The hotel is in an absolutely awesome location, walking distance to pretty much anywhere you would need to go. If you require transportation there is a subway station right across the street making it very easy to get around the city! The only reason I am rating this hotel a 3 is because it is a very old building as many are in the downtown area. The Hallways are very outdated, the elevator is extremely old. With that being said the rooms itself were good, nice bed and bathroom, very comfortable when you are in the room. We did see some other hotels within the downtown location and they did look very classy compared to this hotel. I do have to mention however the great service we received from the front desk staff! They were very friendly to us and always willing to assisst us with directions and questions. We pretty much only saw 2 front desk staff working these 4 days we were there morning through evening. They do work very hard and do a good job! I enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Express Boston Garden! This is an average hotel in a great location within the city! If we were to return to Boston I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “3 YESes - location, free breakfast, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: sono1helen
Reviews.Content: All we needed is : 1. location to everywhere we wanted to go to, 2. good breakfast 3. room â€“ clean comfy bed, washroom/shower, maybe internet 4. Gym Weâ€™ve got it all â€“ hard to rate this hotel â€“ its very very old building. I think itâ€™s used to be old residential building, or old factory. It has this musty smell. My husband priority club member â€“ so 3 nights cost us $0 Now if Iâ€™d be paying â€“ maybe Iâ€™d have something to complain about, but I donâ€™t know even know what about â€“ smell? Old carpets? Itâ€™s not bothering me that much They had pretty good small gym. There were couple of bars downstairs, we heard people during the nights but we were too tired after 12 hours touring around the city that we didnâ€™t even paid attention to it. Even though it look weird hotel location - the streets around this area are extremely safe. Iâ€™m surprised parking cost you 36.00/night when there is $10.00 charge behind the corner on the same street? We didnâ€™t have a car â€“ we flew from Buffalo and used weekly transportation pass â€“ 15.00/week â€“ takes you anywhere you need to go â€“ why drive? Rooms were cleaned daily, fresh breakfast â€“ bagels, toasts, cheese, eggs, muffins, juices, coffe/tea/ milk, yogurts, fruits â€“ what else do you need? Great customer service. Good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: marybink
Reviews.Content: Located across from the Boston Garden and walking distance to the subway and commuter rail. Lots of bars and restaurants in the area. We were upgraded to a suite which was nice. Only negatives about the room was that the toilet continued to run if you didn't wiggle the handle and the thermostat was falling off the wall and didn't always work. Room had a separate bedroom with a flat screen TV. Room included a refrigerator. Holiday Inn Express always has a nice breakfast buffet and this one was no different. Friendly front desk staff. Overall a very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel. Noting more, nothing less.”
Reviews.Author: Tal K
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 nights for business purposes. I chose this hotel for three reasons: 1. It was available at the time of booking (two days prior to arrival) 2. It is walking distance from MGH (Mass General Hospital) which I was doing business with. 3. It was well priced, as they have special MGH rates. Overall the hotel is just OK. The room is OK - not large but not very small. The bed is OK - not too comfy but not too bad either. Cleanliness is OK - not spotless clean, but not dirty, either. View - the gym across the street The room contains a small kitchenette - totally unneeded for me. It also has a small fridge, which is always nice. It has a nice full HD TV - perfect for playing those movies off your laptop (if you bring the right cables). The wifi worked OK - not very fast, not too sluggish. The breakfast is complimentary and also OK. Some muffins, waffles, coffee, cereal - you really don't need more than that. The fitness center is mediocre - a very small room with a not-really-working A/C, two treadmills, two bicycles, some dumbbells and a physio ball. You can pull off a workout, but that's pretty lame. The staff is OK - not too friendly, but not obnoxious either. The building is quite old, the elevator is lousy - gets stuck quite often. The location was good for me, since it was close to my colleagues' office at the MGH. However, this street is somewhat shabby - there are always homeless people at the end of the street and a loud and sleazy bar nearby. Besides that the location is fine. A few nice pubs and sports bars in the parallel streets. There is a 7 eleven and a CVS nearby. It is also a decent location for Boston sightseeing, and right across from the TD garden if you are attending an event over there. Overall it did the job for me, although I cannot say I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again Management does not care”
Reviews.Author: Rama S
Reviews.Content: Made reservation via the official IHG website using Holiday Inn Rewards points. Wanted a room with two beds. That option was not presented. So I put a note and followed up with a phone call. Called again on the afternoon of arrival and requested that a room with two beds be kept aside for me as I was travelling with my daughter. Did not happen. We got a room (they call it suite) with one bed and one sofa bed. Could not sleep on the sofa bed as it was very saggy and ended up with a sore back. Slept the rest of the night on the floor. Earlier could not find the remote control. Called front office and was assured that another one will be sent up. No one arrived for half an hour. Went down to get it myself. Was told they do not have a spare and that I should look for it under the bed or between the seats of the sofa. I told them that they should be doing that not me. Their come back was that if you don't want to look for it then use the controls on the TV. It was getting late at night so decided to go to bed instead. Left as soon as possible in the morning. Tried to get a resolution thru their corporate customer relations department. They kept referring my complaint to hotel management suggesting that they will get back to me. After 4 attempts I did not hear back from hotel management so I gave up. I am a Platinum Priority with Holiday Inn and this is the type of service I get. I am afraid to think what they do to average folks. Am seriously considering taking my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff...went above and beyond!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingfamily7
Reviews.Content: We were with a large group of 22 on on our way to my sons baseball tournament. There were 22 of us and we arrived at 7 am to check in, after taking a red eye from Califonia. Most of the people in our group were children. The staff welcomed us (Thank you Gio) allowed us to eat breakfast and crash in the lobby until our rooms were ready. They got all of us in quickly and when our suite wasn't ready they gave us two standard rooms so we would have plenty of room for our family to be comfortable, at no extra charge. The location was great, right across from the Garden home of the Bruins, and we were there when they won the Stanley cup. Even though the game was in Canada the area was packed with excitment. We were excited to be a part of it all and became Bruins fans! The Boston police did an excellent job of keeping everything under control. The hotel did an excellent job of handling the extra traffic and chaos too. The manger, Jamie, was very nice and gave ice cream and candy treats to the kids. The area did not seem bad to me at all. There are a lot of pubs in the area, but there seem to be alot of pubs all over Boston. We were with in walking distance of many areas of attraction and we were able to purchase our tour bus tickets at the front desk and catch the bus across the street. The rooms were nothing fancy, but every one in our group agreed that this was a great experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What do you compromise on, for value?”
Reviews.Author: Jayme12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the north end and all that is offered here...and that is quite a lot; little Italy, historical monuments and the Freedom Trail - well worth it. Although the rooms are really quite spacious and if you use them as we did, you can overlook some things - the slightly dated decor, dirty looking carpets and a rough looking location. As a value for money sleeping place it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dooper84
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we needed a room in Boston that sleeps five and the choices were pretty limited. The room was big, but it was tired looking - carpet stained, scuff marks on the walls and doors. The location, close to the T, Boston Garden, North End, Quincy Market, was great. As a previous review mentioned, there are homeless in the area who ask for money and comment on everyone who walks by (a little creepy, for sure). Breakfast was decent - eggs, sausage or bacon, biscuits, cereals, yogurt, milk, juices, coffee, bagels, muffins, toast, few pieces of fresh fruit. Even with five of us we only had one morning we couldn't find a seat in the breakfast area. We didn't spend much time in the room other than sleeping, and if that's your plan, this could be a good choice hotel for you. Staff was friendly and accommodating. If they'd repaint it would go far to making the hotel look better. Elevator was a bit creeky, but it is an old building.

Reviews.Title: “Some good things - some not so good...”
Reviews.Author: OldWoodster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2011 as part of our annual family summer vacation. There were four in our party and we booked 2 seperate rooms. I'll start with the good points. On arrival the receptionist was very friendly and helpful and got us checked in into two adjacent rooms. The rooms were quite big and spacious and were on the 3rd floor. The hotel is in a very central location, very convenient for heading out on foot into the city or via the metro station directly across the road from the hotel. On the negative side the hotel is in a rough area, there are some seedy places around and seems to be in an area where homeless people congregate - I felt sorry for these folks but it is a bit alarming when returning to the hotel late in the evening to be accosted by lots of people begging. The hotel itself is a bit tired - even after the recent renovations and the breakfast area is not big enough to seat everyone in the morning. Also the breakfast staff were pretty poor - food was always running out and tables were not being cleared promptly. We enjoyed our stay in Boston and didnt have any real problems but I dont think that I would stay at this hotel again - I am sure that there are better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but probably won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: missg920
Reviews.Content: The street looked a little sketchy, but Valet service was a bonus, and the location was GREAT. Very close to Little Italy, the Subway system, CVS pharmacy, Quincy Market. I stayed on the pullout couch (YUCK), and we could hear people talking/ walking around outside throughout the night/morning. Bars were only a block away (they were okay), but I probably wouldn't choose this hotel again. Oh yeah, and this couple had left their luggage behind the desk prior to check- in so they could walk around the city, and the manager couldn't find it when they came back. YIKES.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but better options are available!”
Reviews.Author: JMWWL
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel in a good location, but the rooms are very small and the hotel is very run down! We stayed on points for six nights recently and were very disappointed. You will hear noise from the bars across the street. If you make a reservation, please ask what year they last renovated? Breakfast was marginal. As an FYI, we didn't have a car since the North subway station was very close and convenient, but parking is $40/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great personable service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Bruins Stanley Cup parade. From the front desk to the valet guys, the service was second to none. Geez, they even waived the 2nd day parking because the streets were closed and access to our car was limited. Clean rooms, great location, helpful staff = returning customers.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel needs better security”
Reviews.Author: EvenVoltage
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in Septemeber to attend a concert and to visit some of Boston's attractions. The best aspect of this hotel is its location. My room was freezing and adjusting the temp. controls had no effect. The main problem with this hotel was that there were 4 neanderthals in the room next to me screaming, throwing furniture, wrestling, staying up all night and throwing things in the hallway. I complained the first night and nothing happened. You could even tell by this group of guests' behavior in the lobby that this group was a problem. The Bruins had their first exhibition game on my second night at this Holiday Inn. So at first, I wondered if these guys were hockey players because they were all huge. But I eventually realized that they were just to moronic to be professional hockey players. On the 2nd night I confronted them myself, and of course they just threatened me in return. 4 against 1 was not a fair situation and I had no one on my side. I wondered how on earth none of the other guests on my floor were complaining about them. Of course, these idots were the last room on the floor and I was in the room right next to them with no one else on the other side of them. Still, they were all over the hallway causing problems. Thanks Holiday Inn for putting my right next to 4 loud jerks. And thanks (very sarcastic) for not doing anything to boot these idiots. At minimun, this Holiday Inn has a security problem, along with a certain amount of tolerance for loud guests. The second night, I got threatened and I got no sleep whatsoever as a result of this. I love the location, but I don't know if I'd stay there again after my first nightmare there.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and courteous staff with great location”
Reviews.Author: jt50ish
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the boston garden hotel on friend street near the fleet center and it was an overall good experience. when i checked in i was greeted by jahayra, who i think was the manager, and she made the whole thing effortless and was also very helpful with a few questions i had. the room itself was very efficient and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable night”
Reviews.Author: ajbaker1980-25
Reviews.Content: Hello my name is Tony and I recently had the pleasure of spending a night here. I had just finished going to a Bruins game and was in no condition to drive so I decided to find a hotel for the night. After walking around for a bit trying to find a cheap hotel I came across The Holiday Inn which is located right next to the garden and the subway. I walked in and was impressed by the cleanliness of the front lobby and the friendlessness of Duke the person who checked me in . I was very impressed with his attitude and professional he showed to me. Once i arrived to my room i was very impressed it was recently remodeled and it was up to date. There was a flat screen TV to watch and the beds we comfortable. The bathroom was also very modern. I would differently recommend this hotel top any one who is at game and not able to drive. i will differently return!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel at Boston Garden or Holiday Inn Express?”
Reviews.Author: Nomad1978
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this facility in the past and it was a Holiday Inn Express, but then saw the name change to "The Hotel" I am confused if it is still a Holiday Inn property? The property was a great choice as the location is great, and I was able to book on rewards points. I see it is available on the Holiday Inn website, can anyone explain? thanks..Dan

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Celtic_Shire
Reviews.Content: We went to a Celtics game with a group of 22 people. The others stayed at the Omni and we stayed here at the Holiday Inn Express. The others in our group met us for a pre game dinner and when they seen the location of this hotel they decided the whole group would stay here next year on our annual trip. The hotel manager was extremely helpful and the staff was pleasant as well. Our room was clean and comfortable. I would never stay anywhere else while attending an event at the Garden. The convenience of being directly across the street was great. There are dozens of great places to eat, all within a few hundred feet of this hotel! If you are attending any Garden event i would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AndyRobo1811
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night while in Boston to watch the Celtics play. In an ideal location if you're planning on going to the TD Garden. On arrival i was given a compliamentry upgrade. Although this wasnt a suprise due to friends status with holiday inn rewards scheme it wasn't guarateed so was a nice bonus on the stay. Room was a little loud but considering i was there for a basketball game you have to expect some shouting outside as its literally across the road from The Garden.. Room was a little basic but i wasnt expecting anything more. What it was, was a great base to watch a game of basketball. The bed was also very comfy which is all that i required for that night. On the downside the breakfast in the morning was poor and would recomend that people staying dont bother paying the extra money for it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rupacked
Reviews.Content: Front desk was warm and very helpful. Rooms are small but well appointed and furnishings and linens were modern and stylish. Yes there was street noise but if you want to be right near the Garden and the bars in that area is this is a great place to stay. If I were staying in Boston and interested in sight seeing I would check to make sure there are no games or concerts that night. Unless you will be one of the ones singing on the street at 2 am!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Consumati
Reviews.Content: I read the negative reviews of this hotel and was a little apprehensive. I had no issues at all and have already recommended the hotel to several friends and colleagues. Is it a luxury hotel? No, it's a former Holiday Inn Express in downtown Boston. Could we hear noise from outside? Yes. The hotel overlooks a busy street. That's to be expected. Was the air conditioner noisy? Yes, but who cares. At the end of the day, it's a fairly basic hotel. Clean, quiet, private. You get what you pay for. We wanted someplace downtown where we could be based while we celebrated the new year, and got all that and more. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service. Great location”
Reviews.Author: colleenndutch
Reviews.Content: was double charged for room.. Still trying to get my money back! Waited till we fell asleep for a bottle opener and had to hold toilet handle to get toilet to flush. Great location and rooms though.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zannaoj
Reviews.Content: I have nothing good to say about my 3 night stay here. The room was suppose to have two beds, which it did not. They couldn't change the room until the next day so I got to sleep on the floor as three people do not fit in one bed. Oh and the bars outside sounded like a re-enactment of Stomp outside my window till 4am.The next room did not have working heat!!!! but they were kind enough to give us a space heater. The next day we woke up to no hot water in the entire place. When i got my car from the valet service, the glove compartment and center console had been completely rummaged through and the contents all over my car!!! Do no book at this place ever!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping was impossible!”
Reviews.Author: CalmBlueOcean70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for several days in October. The room was clean and spacious, and the location seemed perfect. It is across the street from North Station and a trolley tour spot. The problem is that the hotel is surrounded by bars, and the windows do not block any noise whatsoever! Friday night - bar fights right outside, screaming, cursing, garbage trucks, etc all night long. Saturday night - a repeat of Friday night with the added adventure of a man's bloodcurdling scream followed by sirens and firetrucks outside. Although the hotel slightly discounted our room because of the noise, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone on a weekend night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic getaway... if you like bar fights!”
Reviews.Author: JulieG82
Reviews.Content: I offered Boston College football tickets to my boyfriend for his birthday. We flew from Montreal, Canada, to watch the game. When I booked the trip I figure we would easily find a hotel in Boston in October... I did not know that it was the weekend for the regatta Head of the Charles with thousands of people coming from all over the world to compete. The accommodation prices were crazy high and we had to settle for a $295 A NIGHT for The Hotel at Boston Garden which is in reality simply a Holiday Inn Express. The hotel is situated in what looks like a very quiet street just across Boston Garden where the Boston Bruins and Celtics play. It is also just across a train station, the North Station, which is nice when you want to visit and use the very old subway. The room (415) was a corner room which seemed nice at first, (4 windows, nice couch, flat screen tv, lots of light) was more like posing as a suite with a kitchenette (mini fridge - not minibar - kitchen sink, microwave, kitchen cabinets) but in fact the cabinets were totally empty, we could not even find or get a regular glass. But the beds were clean and very comfortable and the bathroom facilities were ok. We figured, it's gonna be fine.... Until the night comes..... The very quiet street has in fact many bars, clubs and sports bars. On the Saturday night, between 1:30 to 2:30 a.m., it was literally impossible to sleep since everybody was exiting the bars and having lots of fun discussing it on the street. There was no noise isolation at all... And alcohol being involved, it quickly became fights, people yelling at each other, calling names and using the F word... Classy... I know, you would say, it was a game night. Its probably not like that every night... Well, on the night before on Friday, the Bruins were not playing and we had even worst fights at 1:00 and 2:00 a.m. At one point, the fight was so intense, I thought we would hear gun shots... So, if you are a light sleeper... or a nervous sleeper, forget about this place and invest a little bit more to sleep in Beacon Hill where it actually seemed nice, romantic and... quiet! However, if you are a hockey fan who likes to party, this is the place for you!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Boston Garden
HotelInfo.Address: 280 Friend Street, Boston, MA 02114 (Formerly The Hotel at Boston Garden)
